intro: Solanum rancagunium, commonly known as the Rancagunium nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically purple or white in color. Its fruit is a yellowish berry that contains several seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is not commonly cultivated or used in agriculture.
